attributes.action: Reopen the Footpath from Bottom Lane to Market Drayton nature reserve
attributes.additional_details: The footpath in question is a much-loved route within our community, frequently used by residents for walking, jogging, and particularly as a popular dog walking route. Its closure has significantly impacted local residents’ ability to enjoy outdoor activities and connect with nature. The path promotes physical health, mental well-being, and social interaction among residents. Reopening this footpath will restore these important benefits to the community and uphold our right to access public spaces.
attributes.background: Direct the local council to reopen the footpath from Bottom Lane through Market Drayton Nature Reserve to Salisbury Hill View, remove barriers restricting access, and provide a transparent explanation for the closure. Ensure community consultation for future changes.
